title: Liverpool's Jurgen Klopp pours cold water on Joe Hart transfer talk by hailing his "really, really good keepers"
text:
Sport Liverpool's Jurgen Klopp pours cold water on Joe Hart transfer talk by hailing his "really, really good keepers" Man City's England No1 is being linked with a move to Anfield but the manager has now strongly backed Simon Mignolet and Loris Karius Share Karius and Mignolet's position may be the only one Liverpool DON'T address this summer (Photo: AMA/Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Jurgen Klopp has offered the strongest evidence yet he will resist urgent fan calls to buy another goalie in the summer. 
The Liverpool manager has indicated he could bring in as many as seven or eight new faces for next season — but dashed the hopes of critical supporters by suggesting a new keeper won’t be among them. 
Asked if he was totally happy with first-teamers Simon Mignolet and Loris Karius, signed last summer from German club Mainz, boss Klopp replied: “I am happy most of the days. 
“One day when a goalkeeper is involved in a goal which happens quite a few times it is the life of a goalkeeper that you are the last man standing. Then you are not too happy. But I am happy with our goalkeepers, yes.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
